Text saved: Asteroids are rocks that fly through space. Some of these are called 'Potentially Hazardous Asteroids', which means they are rocks that could be dangerous. They come close enough to go less than 7.5 million kilometres from Earth's path around the sun. NASA has made a map of 1,400 of these dangerous asteroids, but not one of them is believed to be a danger in the next one hundred years. NASA can follow these objects and make guesses about a possible hit, using the tools and systems that are already available. If an asteroid might hit, two ways to protect Earth could be used.
